text: Create a GIS map of informal waste dumping sites around Green Park Extension. The project must combine GPS points, open satellite imagery, and simple spatial analysis to identify clusters of illegal dumping. Outputs should include a priority list of locations for municipal action.

Prepare a flood susceptibility map for University Campus using open DEM and land-use data. The team will delineate low-lying areas, indicate major flow paths, and mark critical facilities like schools and health centres. Results should be summarized in a two-page note for disaster management staff.

Create a GIS map of informal waste dumping sites around Transport Nagar. The project must combine GPS points, open satellite imagery, and simple spatial analysis to identify clusters of illegal dumping. Outputs should include a priority list of locations for municipal action.

Estimate rooftop rainwater harvesting potential for a group of houses in Yamuna Enclave using GIS. The team should digitize roof areas, combine them with rainfall data, and suggest storage tank sizes. A one-page recommendation sheet for each house is required.

Design a low-cost water quality survey of handpumps in Shivaji Nagar. Students will create a sampling schedule, test for turbidity, pH, and residual chlorine, and log data in a structured spreadsheet. The goal is to flag unsafe sources and prepare a one-page brief for the local health worker.

Prepare a flood susceptibility map for Ward 12 using open DEM and land-use data. The team will delineate low-lying areas, indicate major flow paths, and mark critical facilities like schools and health centres. Results should be summarized in a two-page note for disaster management staff.

Estimate rooftop rainwater harvesting potential for a group of houses in Industrial Layout using GIS. The team should digitize roof areas, combine them with rainfall data, and suggest storage tank sizes. A one-page recommendation sheet for each house is required.

Estimate rooftop rainwater harvesting potential for a group of houses in Lalbagh using GIS. The team should digitize roof areas, combine them with rainfall data, and suggest storage tank sizes. A one-page recommendation sheet for each house is required.

Develop a small web-based tool to prioritize drainage improvements in Lakeview Colony using citizen complaints and flood history. The tool must score locations based on multiple factors and export a ranked list. It should be simple enough for ward engineers to operate without training.

Plan a coordinated riverbank cleanup for a 4.2 km stretch near Riverfront Colony. The project should map dumping hotspots, schedule volunteer shifts, and propose simple silt traps to stop plastics from re-entering the stream. It must also include a brief safety protocol for working close to fast-flowing water.

Develop a simple QGIS workflow to register drinking water sources and attach lab test results in Riverfront Colony. The tool should let users filter sources by parameter exceedance and export basic risk maps. The workflow must be documented step by step for non-expert staff.

Build a mobile-friendly grievance app for reporting clogged drains and overflowing bins in Ganga Vihar. The app should capture geo-tagged photos, categorize severity, and generate simple summary reports for municipal engineers. Offline data capture and later sync are desirable features.

Create a GIS map of informal waste dumping sites around Ward 8. The project must combine GPS points, open satellite imagery, and simple spatial analysis to identify clusters of illegal dumping. Outputs should include a priority list of locations for municipal action.

Prepare a policy brief comparing local construction debris rules in Station Road Area with best practices from other cities. The project will review bylaws, interview at least two stakeholders, and highlight specific clauses that hinder or support better waste management. Recommendations must be realistic for a medium-sized municipality.

Design a low-cost greywater reuse system for a hostel block in University Campus. The project must estimate flows from bathrooms and wash areas, choose simple treatment units, and propose safe reuse for gardening. Construction cost and maintenance effort should be clearly stated.

Carry out microbiological testing of stored household drinking water in Transport Nagar, comparing it with source water quality. The project should follow strict sampling hygiene and laboratory protocols. Recommendations must focus on low-cost household behavior changes.

Prototype a solar-powered pump system to lift water from a small farm pond near Green Park Extension. Students must select a suitable pump, estimate daily water yield, and match it to crop water requirements. A laminated one-page maintenance guide for farmers should be produced.

Compare lifecycle costs of diesel generators vs solar-battery systems for rural clinics around Ganga Vihar. The project involves collecting basic load data, modeling costs over ten years, and running sensitivity scenarios. Results must be shared in a concise briefing with charts.

Develop a small web-based tool to prioritize drainage improvements in Ward 8 using citizen complaints and flood history. The tool must score locations based on multiple factors and export a ranked list. It should be simple enough for ward engineers to operate without training.

Design a low-cost water quality survey of handpumps in Hostel Zone B. Students will create a sampling schedule, test for turbidity, pH, and residual chlorine, and log data in a structured spreadsheet. The goal is to flag unsafe sources and prepare a one-page brief for the local health worker.

Plan and deliver a community awareness campaign on safe water storage and handling in Lakeview Colony. The team will create posters, run one or two interactive sessions, and measure pre- and post-session knowledge. Findings should be documented with photos and short quotes from participants.

Prepare a flood susceptibility map for Yamuna Enclave using open DEM and land-use data. The team will delineate low-lying areas, indicate major flow paths, and mark critical facilities like schools and health centres. Results should be summarized in a two-page note for disaster management staff.

The project will review bylaws, interview at least two stakeholders, and highlight specific clauses that hinder or support better waste management. Recommendations must be realistic for a medium-sized municipality.

Build a mobile-friendly grievance app for reporting clogged drains and overflowing bins in University Campus. The app should capture geo-tagged photos, categorize severity, and generate simple summary reports for municipal engineers. Offline data capture and later sync are desirable features.

Prototype an IoT-based flood alert node for a low bridge used by school children in Riverfront Colony. The system should use an ultrasonic or pressure sensor, run on battery or solar, and send SMS alerts when water crosses a warning threshold. The design must consider vandalism risk and intermittent network coverage.

Build a mobile-friendly grievance app for reporting clogged drains and overflowing bins in Ward 12. The app should capture geo-tagged photos, categorize severity, and generate simple summary reports for municipal engineers. Offline data capture and later sync are desirable features.

Design a low-cost water quality survey of handpumps in Station Road Area. Students will create a sampling schedule, test for turbidity, pH, and residual chlorine, and log data in a structured spreadsheet. The goal is to flag unsafe sources and prepare a one-page brief for the local health worker.

Design a combined air quality and noise monitoring node for a busy junction in Ward 12. The system will log PM levels and sound pressure to the cloud, along with timestamps. Simple visualizations and a short note on health implications are expected.

Create a GIS map of informal waste dumping sites around Transport Nagar. The project must combine GPS points, open satellite imagery, and simple spatial analysis to identify clusters of illegal dumping. Outputs should include a priority list of locations for municipal action.

Design a low-cost greywater reuse system for a hostel block in Hostel Zone B. The project must estimate flows from bathrooms and wash areas, choose simple treatment units, and propose safe reuse for gardening. Construction cost and maintenance effort should be clearly stated.

Estimate rooftop rainwater harvesting potential for a group of houses in Green Park Extension using GIS. The team should digitize roof areas, combine them with rainfall data, and suggest storage tank sizes. A one-page recommendation sheet for each house is required.

Prototype an IoT-based flood alert node for a low bridge used by school children in Old Town. The system should use an ultrasonic or pressure sensor, run on battery or solar, and send SMS alerts when water crosses a warning threshold. The design must consider vandalism risk and intermittent network coverage.

Build a mobile-friendly grievance app for reporting clogged drains and overflowing bins in Riverfront Colony. The app should capture geo-tagged photos, categorize severity, and generate simple summary reports for municipal engineers. Offline data capture and later sync are desirable features.

Estimate rooftop rainwater harvesting potential for a group of houses in Station Road Area using GIS. The team should digitize roof areas, combine them with rainfall data, and suggest storage tank sizes. A one-page recommendation sheet for each house is required.

The system should use an ultrasonic or pressure sensor, run on battery or solar, and send SMS alerts when water crosses a warning threshold. The design must consider vandalism risk and intermittent network coverage.

Prepare a flood susceptibility map for Ward 8 using open DEM and land-use data. The team will delineate low-lying areas, indicate major flow paths, and mark critical facilities like schools and health centres. Results should be summarized in a two-page note for disaster management staff.

Develop a simple QGIS workflow to register drinking water sources and attach lab test results in Station Road Area. The tool should let users filter sources by parameter exceedance and export basic risk maps. The workflow must be documented step by step for non-expert staff.

Compare lifecycle costs of diesel generators vs solar-battery systems for rural clinics around Industrial Layout. The project involves collecting basic load data, modeling costs over ten years, and running sensitivity scenarios. Results must be shared in a concise briefing with charts.

Conduct a household survey on plastic waste segregation behaviors in University Campus. The project will design a short questionnaire, digitize responses in a mobile form, and present results to the ward committee. It should also suggest two or three locally feasible behavior-change messages.

Design a rooftop solar micro-project for a government school close to Riverfront Colony. The team should estimate typical classroom loads, size the panel array, and prepare a basic financial payback analysis. A concise safety and maintenance checklist for school staff must also be included.

The project will review bylaws, interview at least two stakeholders, and highlight specific clauses that hinder or support better waste management. Recommendations must be realistic for a medium-sized municipality.

Plan a coordinated riverbank cleanup for a 1.7 km stretch near Lalbagh. The project should map dumping hotspots, schedule volunteer shifts, and propose simple silt traps to stop plastics from re-entering the stream. It must also include a brief safety protocol for working close to fast-flowing water.

Develop a simple QGIS workflow to register drinking water sources and attach lab test results in Transport Nagar. The tool should let users filter sources by parameter exceedance and export basic risk maps. The workflow must be documented step by step for non-expert staff.

Design a combined air quality and noise monitoring node for a busy junction in Station Road Area. The system will log PM levels and sound pressure to the cloud, along with timestamps. Simple visualizations and a short note on health implications are expected.

Prepare a flood susceptibility map for Ward 8 using open DEM and land-use data. The team will delineate low-lying areas, indicate major flow paths, and mark critical facilities like schools and health centres. Results should be summarized in a two-page note for disaster management staff.

Design a low-cost water quality survey of handpumps in Ganga Vihar. Students will create a sampling schedule, test for turbidity, pH, and residual chlorine, and log data in a structured spreadsheet. The goal is to flag unsafe sources and prepare a one-page brief for the local health worker.

Design a low-cost greywater reuse system for a hostel block in Ward 8. The project must estimate flows from bathrooms and wash areas, choose simple treatment units, and propose safe reuse for gardening. Construction cost and maintenance effort should be clearly stated.

Implement smart fill-level monitoring on dustbins across the university campus near Yamuna Enclave. Sensors should estimate bin fullness and send data to a basic dashboard to optimize collection routes. The design must account for low-cost maintenance and robust installation.

Conduct a household survey on plastic waste segregation behaviors in Old Town. The project will design a short questionnaire, digitize responses in a mobile form, and present results to the ward committee. It should also suggest two or three locally feasible behavior-change messages.

Prototype a solar-powered pump system to lift water from a small farm pond near Hostel Zone B. Students must select a suitable pump, estimate daily water yield, and match it to crop water requirements. A laminated one-page maintenance guide for farmers should be produced.

Implement smart fill-level monitoring on dustbins across the university campus near Ward 12. Sensors should estimate bin fullness and send data to a basic dashboard to optimize collection routes. The design must account for low-cost maintenance and robust installation.

Plan a coordinated riverbank cleanup for a 4.1 km stretch near Shivaji Nagar. The project should map dumping hotspots, schedule volunteer shifts, and propose simple silt traps to stop plastics from re-entering the stream. It must also include a brief safety protocol for working close to fast-flowing water.

Compare lifecycle costs of diesel generators vs solar-battery systems for rural clinics around Lakeview Colony. The project involves collecting basic load data, modeling costs over ten years, and running sensitivity scenarios. Results must be shared in a concise briefing with charts.

Carry out microbiological testing of stored household drinking water in Transport Nagar, comparing it with source water quality. The project should follow strict sampling hygiene and laboratory protocols. Recommendations must focus on low-cost household behavior changes.

Prepare a policy brief comparing local construction debris rules in Old Town with best practices from other cities. The project will review bylaws, interview at least two stakeholders, and highlight specific clauses that hinder or support better waste management. Recommendations must be realistic for a medium-sized municipality.

Build a mobile-friendly grievance app for reporting clogged drains and overflowing bins in Riverfront Colony. The app should capture geo-tagged photos, categorize severity, and generate simple summary reports for municipal engineers. Offline data capture and later sync are desirable features.

Prototype an IoT-based flood alert node for a low bridge used by school children in Riverfront Colony. The system should use an ultrasonic or pressure sensor, run on battery or solar, and send SMS alerts when water crosses a warning threshold. The design must consider vandalism risk and intermittent network coverage.

Create an online training module for sewer maintenance teams operating near Ward 12. The module should translate confined space entry rules into short checklists, visuals, and self-test questions. Feedback from at least three workers must be recorded and summarized.

Compare lifecycle costs of diesel generators vs solar-battery systems for rural clinics around Green Park Extension. The project involves collecting basic load data, modeling costs over ten years, and running sensitivity scenarios. Results must be shared in a concise briefing with charts.

Conduct a household survey on plastic waste segregation behaviors in Ganga Vihar. The project will design a short questionnaire, digitize responses in a mobile form, and present results to the ward committee. It should also suggest two or three locally feasible behavior-change messages.

Carry out microbiological testing of stored household drinking water in Ward 8, comparing it with source water quality. The project should follow strict sampling hygiene and laboratory protocols. Recommendations must focus on low-cost household behavior changes.

Prepare a flood susceptibility map for Riverfront Colony using open DEM and land-use data. The team will delineate low-lying areas, indicate major flow paths, and mark critical facilities like schools and health centres. Results should be summarized in a two-page note for disaster management staff.

Create a GIS map of informal waste dumping sites around Old Town. The project must combine GPS points, open satellite imagery, and simple spatial analysis to identify clusters of illegal dumping. Outputs should include a priority list of locations for municipal action.

Create an online training module for sewer maintenance teams operating near Lakeview Colony. The module should translate confined space entry rules into short checklists, visuals, and self-test questions. Feedback from at least three workers must be recorded and summarized.

Design a rooftop solar micro-project for a government school close to Riverfront Colony. The team should estimate typical classroom loads, size the panel array, and prepare a basic financial payback analysis. A concise safety and maintenance checklist for school staff must also be included.

Design a combined air quality and noise monitoring node for a busy junction in Station Road Area. The system will log PM levels and sound pressure to the cloud, along with timestamps. Simple visualizations and a short note on health implications are expected.

The project should map dumping hotspots, schedule volunteer shifts, and propose simple silt traps to stop plastics from re-entering the stream. It must also include a brief safety protocol for working close to fast-flowing water.

Design a low-cost greywater reuse system for a hostel block in University Campus. The project must estimate flows from bathrooms and wash areas, choose simple treatment units, and propose safe reuse for gardening. Construction cost and maintenance effort should be clearly stated.

Prototype an IoT-based flood alert node for a low bridge used by school children in Yamuna Enclave. The system should use an ultrasonic or pressure sensor, run on battery or solar, and send SMS alerts when water crosses a warning threshold. The design must consider vandalism risk and intermittent network coverage.

Create a GIS map of informal waste dumping sites around Transport Nagar. The project must combine GPS points, open satellite imagery, and simple spatial analysis to identify clusters of illegal dumping. Outputs should include a priority list of locations for municipal action.

Design a combined air quality and noise monitoring node for a busy junction in Ward 12. The system will log PM levels and sound pressure to the cloud, along with timestamps. Simple visualizations and a short note on health implications are expected.

Prototype a solar-powered pump system to lift water from a small farm pond near Ward 8. Students must select a suitable pump, estimate daily water yield, and match it to crop water requirements. A laminated one-page maintenance guide for farmers should be produced.

Develop a simple QGIS workflow to register drinking water sources and attach lab test results in Lakeview Colony. The tool should let users filter sources by parameter exceedance and export basic risk maps. The workflow must be documented step by step for non-expert staff.

Design a rooftop solar micro-project for a government school close to Ward 8. The team should estimate typical classroom loads, size the panel array, and prepare a basic financial payback analysis. A concise safety and maintenance checklist for school staff must also be included.

Plan a coordinated riverbank cleanup for a 2.0 km stretch near Transport Nagar. The project should map dumping hotspots, schedule volunteer shifts, and propose simple silt traps to stop plastics from re-entering the stream. It must also include a brief safety protocol for working close to fast-flowing water.

Design a rooftop solar micro-project for a government school close to Station Road Area. The team should estimate typical classroom loads, size the panel array, and prepare a basic financial payback analysis. A concise safety and maintenance checklist for school staff must also be included.

Prototype an IoT-based flood alert node for a low bridge used by school children in Green Park Extension. The system should use an ultrasonic or pressure sensor, run on battery or solar, and send SMS alerts when water crosses a warning threshold. The design must consider vandalism risk and intermittent network coverage.

Design a combined air quality and noise monitoring node for a busy junction in Old Town. The system will log PM levels and sound pressure to the cloud, along with timestamps. Simple visualizations and a short note on health implications are expected.

Implement smart fill-level monitoring on dustbins across the university campus near Station Road Area. Sensors should estimate bin fullness and send data to a basic dashboard to optimize collection routes. The design must account for low-cost maintenance and robust installation.

Prototype a solar-powered pump system to lift water from a small farm pond near Yamuna Enclave. Students must select a suitable pump, estimate daily water yield, and match it to crop water requirements. A laminated one-page maintenance guide for farmers should be produced.

Design a low-cost greywater reuse system for a hostel block in Old Town. The project must estimate flows from bathrooms and wash areas, choose simple treatment units, and propose safe reuse for gardening. Construction cost and maintenance effort should be clearly stated.

Carry out microbiological testing of stored household drinking water in Hostel Zone B, comparing it with source water quality. The project should follow strict sampling hygiene and laboratory protocols. Recommendations must focus on low-cost household behavior changes.

Prototype a solar-powered pump system to lift water from a small farm pond near Lalbagh. Students must select a suitable pump, estimate daily water yield, and match it to crop water requirements. A laminated one-page maintenance guide for farmers should be produced.

Design a low-cost water quality survey of handpumps in Green Park Extension. Students will create a sampling schedule, test for turbidity, pH, and residual chlorine, and log data in a structured spreadsheet. The goal is to flag unsafe sources and prepare a one-page brief for the local health worker.

Develop a small web-based tool to prioritize drainage improvements in Old Town using citizen complaints and flood history. The tool must score locations based on multiple factors and export a ranked list. It should be simple enough for ward engineers to operate without training.

Prepare a flood susceptibility map for Hostel Zone B using open DEM and land-use data. The team will delineate low-lying areas, indicate major flow paths, and mark critical facilities like schools and health centres. Results should be summarized in a two-page note for disaster management staff.

Design a combined air quality and noise monitoring node for a busy junction in Hostel Zone B. The system will log PM levels and sound pressure to the cloud, along with timestamps. Simple visualizations and a short note on health implications are expected.

Estimate rooftop rainwater harvesting potential for a group of houses in Lalbagh using GIS. The team should digitize roof areas, combine them with rainfall data, and suggest storage tank sizes. A one-page recommendation sheet for each house is required.

Create a GIS map of informal waste dumping sites around Lakeview Colony. The project must combine GPS points, open satellite imagery, and simple spatial analysis to identify clusters of illegal dumping. Outputs should include a priority list of locations for municipal action.

Design a rooftop solar micro-project for a government school close to Ward 8. The team should estimate typical classroom loads, size the panel array, and prepare a basic financial payback analysis. A concise safety and maintenance checklist for school staff must also be included.

Build a mobile-friendly grievance app for reporting clogged drains and overflowing bins in Riverfront Colony. The app should capture geo-tagged photos, categorize severity, and generate simple summary reports for municipal engineers. Offline data capture and later sync are desirable features.

Conduct a household survey on plastic waste segregation behaviors in Lakeview Colony. The project will design a short questionnaire, digitize responses in a mobile form, and present results to the ward committee. It should also suggest two or three locally feasible behavior-change messages.

Design a low-cost greywater reuse system for a hostel block in Industrial Layout. The project must estimate flows from bathrooms and wash areas, choose simple treatment units, and propose safe reuse for gardening. Construction cost and maintenance effort should be clearly stated.

Estimate rooftop rainwater harvesting potential for a group of houses in University Campus using GIS. The team should digitize roof areas, combine them with rainfall data, and suggest storage tank sizes. A one-page recommendation sheet for each house is required.

Implement smart fill-level monitoring on dustbins across the university campus near Ward 12. Sensors should estimate bin fullness and send data to a basic dashboard to optimize collection routes. The design must account for low-cost maintenance and robust installation.

Design a low-cost greywater reuse system for a hostel block in Station Road Area. The project must estimate flows from bathrooms and wash areas, choose simple treatment units, and propose safe reuse for gardening. Construction cost and maintenance effort should be clearly stated.

Design a rooftop solar micro-project for a government school close to Lalbagh. The team should estimate typical classroom loads, size the panel array, and prepare a basic financial payback analysis. A concise safety and maintenance checklist for school staff must also be included.

Build a mobile-friendly grievance app for reporting clogged drains and overflowing bins in Station Road Area. The app should capture geo-tagged photos, categorize severity, and generate simple summary reports for municipal engineers. Offline data capture and later sync are desirable features.

Design a low-cost greywater reuse system for a hostel block in Lakeview Colony. The project must estimate flows from bathrooms and wash areas, choose simple treatment units, and propose safe reuse for gardening. Construction cost and maintenance effort should be clearly stated.

Prepare a flood susceptibility map for University Campus using open DEM and land-use data. The team will delineate low-lying areas, indicate major flow paths, and mark critical facilities like schools and health centres. Results should be summarized in a two-page note for disaster management staff.

Design a low-cost greywater reuse system for a hostel block in Industrial Layout. The project must estimate flows from bathrooms and wash areas, choose simple treatment units, and propose safe reuse for gardening. Construction cost and maintenance effort should be clearly stated.

Plan a coordinated riverbank cleanup for a 5.0 km stretch near University Campus. The project should map dumping hotspots, schedule volunteer shifts, and propose simple silt traps to stop plastics from re-entering the stream. It must also include a brief safety protocol for working close to fast-flowing water.

Estimate rooftop rainwater harvesting potential for a group of houses in Industrial Layout using GIS. The team should digitize roof areas, combine them with rainfall data, and suggest storage tank sizes. A one-page recommendation sheet for each house is required.

Estimate rooftop rainwater harvesting potential for a group of houses in Old Town using GIS. The team should digitize roof areas, combine them with rainfall data, and suggest storage tank sizes. A one-page recommendation sheet for each house is required.

Design a combined air quality and noise monitoring node for a busy junction in Lakeview Colony. The system will log PM levels and sound pressure to the cloud, along with timestamps. Simple visualizations and a short note on health implications are expected.

Develop a small web-based tool to prioritize drainage improvements in Lakeview Colony using citizen complaints and flood history. The tool must score locations based on multiple factors and export a ranked list. It should be simple enough for ward engineers to operate without training.

Create an online training module for sewer maintenance teams operating near Riverfront Colony. The module should translate confined space entry rules into short checklists, visuals, and self-test questions. Feedback from at least three workers must be recorded and summarized.

Build a mobile-friendly grievance app for reporting clogged drains and overflowing bins in Ward 12. The app should capture geo-tagged photos, categorize severity, and generate simple summary reports for municipal engineers. Offline data capture and later sync are desirable features.

Prepare a flood susceptibility map for Lakeview Colony using open DEM and land-use data. The team will delineate low-lying areas, indicate major flow paths, and mark critical facilities like schools and health centres. Results should be summarized in a two-page note for disaster management staff.

Estimate rooftop rainwater harvesting potential for a group of houses in Ward 8 using GIS. The team should digitize roof areas, combine them with rainfall data, and suggest storage tank sizes. A one-page recommendation sheet for each house is required.

Carry out microbiological testing of stored household drinking water in Industrial Layout, comparing it with source water quality. The project should follow strict sampling hygiene and laboratory protocols. Recommendations must focus on low-cost household behavior changes.

Prototype a solar-powered pump system to lift water from a small farm pond near Riverfront Colony. Students must select a suitable pump, estimate daily water yield, and match it to crop water requirements. A laminated one-page maintenance guide for farmers should be produced.

Design a low-cost water quality survey of handpumps in Industrial Layout. Students will create a sampling schedule, test for turbidity, pH, and residual chlorine, and log data in a structured spreadsheet. The goal is to flag unsafe sources and prepare a one-page brief for the local health worker.

Develop a simple QGIS workflow to register drinking water sources and attach lab test results in Ward 8. The tool should let users filter sources by parameter exceedance and export basic risk maps. The workflow must be documented step by step for non-expert staff.

Create a GIS map of informal waste dumping sites around Station Road Area. The project must combine GPS points, open satellite imagery, and simple spatial analysis to identify clusters of illegal dumping. Outputs should include a priority list of locations for municipal action.

Implement smart fill-level monitoring on dustbins across the university campus near Green Park Extension. Sensors should estimate bin fullness and send data to a basic dashboard to optimize collection routes. The design must account for low-cost maintenance and robust installation.

Design a combined air quality and noise monitoring node for a busy junction in Ganga Vihar. The system will log PM levels and sound pressure to the cloud, along with timestamps. Simple visualizations and a short note on health implications are expected.

The system should use an ultrasonic or pressure sensor, run on battery or solar, and send SMS alerts when water crosses a warning threshold. The design must consider vandalism risk and intermittent network coverage.

Prototype a solar-powered pump system to lift water from a small farm pond near Station Road Area. Students must select a suitable pump, estimate daily water yield, and match it to crop water requirements. A laminated one-page maintenance guide for farmers should be produced.

The design must consider vandalism risk and intermittent network coverage.

Plan and deliver a community awareness campaign on safe water storage and handling in Lalbagh. The team will create posters, run one or two interactive sessions, and measure pre- and post-session knowledge. Findings should be documented with photos and short quotes from participants.

Prepare a flood susceptibility map for Old Town using open DEM and land-use data. The team will delineate low-lying areas, indicate major flow paths, and mark critical facilities like schools and health centres. Results should be summarized in a two-page note for disaster management staff.

Implement smart fill-level monitoring on dustbins across the university campus near Lakeview Colony. Sensors should estimate bin fullness and send data to a basic dashboard to optimize collection routes. The design must account for low-cost maintenance and robust installation.

Prepare a flood susceptibility map for Transport Nagar using open DEM and land-use data. The team will delineate low-lying areas, indicate major flow paths, and mark critical facilities like schools and health centres. Results should be summarized in a two-page note for disaster management staff.

Prepare a flood susceptibility map for Transport Nagar using open DEM and land-use data. The team will delineate low-lying areas, indicate major flow paths, and mark critical facilities like schools and health centres. Results should be summarized in a two-page note for disaster management staff.

Build a mobile-friendly grievance app for reporting clogged drains and overflowing bins in Green Park Extension. The app should capture geo-tagged photos, categorize severity, and generate simple summary reports for municipal engineers. Offline data capture and later sync are desirable features.

Prototype an IoT-based flood alert node for a low bridge used by school children in Shivaji Nagar. The system should use an ultrasonic or pressure sensor, run on battery or solar, and send SMS alerts when water crosses a warning threshold. The design must consider vandalism risk and intermittent network coverage.

Develop a small web-based tool to prioritize drainage improvements in Shivaji Nagar using citizen complaints and flood history. The tool must score locations based on multiple factors and export a ranked list. It should be simple enough for ward engineers to operate without training.

Compare lifecycle costs of diesel generators vs solar-battery systems for rural clinics around Shivaji Nagar. The project involves collecting basic load data, modeling costs over ten years, and running sensitivity scenarios. Results must be shared in a concise briefing with charts.

Conduct a household survey on plastic waste segregation behaviors in Old Town. The project will design a short questionnaire, digitize responses in a mobile form, and present results to the ward committee. It should also suggest two or three locally feasible behavior-change messages.

Create a GIS map of informal waste dumping sites around Lakeview Colony. The project must combine GPS points, open satellite imagery, and simple spatial analysis to identify clusters of illegal dumping. Outputs should include a priority list of locations for municipal action.

Implement smart fill-level monitoring on dustbins across the university campus near Transport Nagar. Sensors should estimate bin fullness and send data to a basic dashboard to optimize collection routes. The design must account for low-cost maintenance and robust installation.
